div1.p: Reed promises to bring Emilie Lawrence Reed the money she needs to meet their expenses.

div1.head: Letter from Walter Reed to Emilie Lawrence Reed, June 5, 1902
div1.opener:
A Kiss
for Doogy,
Don't draw
any more
checks!
WAR DEPARTMENT,
SURGEON GENERAL'S OFFICE,
ARMY MEDICAL MUSEUM AND LIBRARY,
WASHINGTON.
Thursday
Evening-
My precious wifie,
div1.p:
How aston-
ished I was to get your
darling letter, this afternoon!
I had to chuckle over your
calling me “Mr Forgetfulness”-
I don't know anything more
appropriate than that -- for
truly when I reached the bot-
tom of the hill & found that
I had even forgotten my val-
ise, I simply had to chuckle!
was ever anything quite so
absurd? That wasn't all!
for when I got near Baltimore,
I found that I had forgotten
my umbrella! Did you ever
hear of such an absent-minded
individual! I would attribute
it to the wind & locusts, had
it not been that I forgot
to take my pajamas and comb
& brush on leaving here- I
seem to have been “all ball-
-ed up”, as the saying goes-
I was glad to get away from
that wind! When we reached
Thurmont, it was apparent-
ly perfectly calm- Miss
Mason says that it blew
here dreadfully all day
Wednesday and, also, Tuesday
night- What a relief it
must have been to you
to have gotten rid of the
wind, the carpenters and a
nervous man all at the
same time- No wonder you
slept until 6 P.M -- !
I found your letter and my
check from Columbian College-
when I got back -- I did not
deposit any to your credit,
as I thought it would be
best for me to draw the checks
for the work, this month,
I will bring you whatever
cash you will need when
I come up- Then at the end
of this month, I will deposit
enough to your credit to ena-
ble you to pay your bills-
Have paid everything at this
end, including Moses & Wood-
ward & Lothrop's bills- I have
$300.00 left, with which I
I want to pay plumber, tin-
ner, Mr Moore & Methren-
I will get commissary list and
send Beechner to fish-man to-
morrow- Miss Mason gave me
his address- will, also, attend
to books for you- Won't fail
to bring Ping-Pong this time-
Think I can come on Saturday
Two candidates left, who will
probably pass- Do pray have
Jacob water that turf, as there
seems to be no rain in sight
yet- Last night was cool
and I slept like a top. I
will remember towels &
knife- Miss Mason's meals
fairly good to-day- Coffee
better- Much love to Mrs.
Stewart and Mrs. Nichols-
Love & kisses for my sweet
Ranch lady-
